title: Colin Powell Was an Insider Who Also Stood Apart
sub_head: Mr. Powell, who died this week, brought an everyman approach to positions of power
body:
If you want to understand the man Colin Powell was, the thing to remember is that his hobby was repairing old Volvo cars.
The passion for car repairs was a vestige of his working-class background, and a metaphor for the everyman approach he brought to positions of power. In a 1990s interview, he said he had bought, repainted, repaired and resold some 30 Volvos, a practice begun when he revived one so his son could have a car in college.
